content.prompt: Many organisms, such as honeybees and livestock, have been domesticated for economic reasons. Which of the following best describes an unintended consequence of this practice?

choices.label: As humans tamed wild organisms to amplify desired traits, genetic diversity decreased in the organisms' populations.
Domestication increases the ability of wild organisms to breed in captivity and produce offspring with desired traits.
As plants became domesticated, humans began to settle in one region because they did not have to hunt animals and gather plants for food.
Animals that are unpredictable in nature and highly dangerous to humans are tamed only in rare instances.

skill.text: Skill 7.C: Describe disadvantages, advantages, or unintended consequences for potential solutions.
